pages.text: Welcome to the $(d)Chaos Plane,$() a dark and dreary world between worlds. Not many things here are friendly, from the $(l:blocks/entropy_reactor#corruptshell)Corrupt Shells$(/l) that roam the surface, to the earth itself. Stay on your toes here and you will stay safe.$(p)Read on for $(6)documentation$() on what can be found in this dastardly dimension.

One important item that can be found here is the $(item)Prism Rose.$() It emits a gentle glow, allowing it to be seen from far away. These spawn in $(thing)Corrupt Plains and Forest$(), and appear in bunches.$(p)Grind these roses to get $(1)Prismatic Dust.

pages.title: Corrupt Ores
pages.text: Underground, in all biomes here, spawn $(item)Corrupt Ore.$() These variants of Minecraft ores (and Titanium) are unique in that they produce $(6)2x the resources when broken,$() making a mining adventure here very profitable.$(p)They also produce 1.5x resources $(2)when ground.

The highly intelligent $(item)Brain Cactus$() is native to the $(thing)Corrupt Desert.$() These cacti are ultra-painful and kill in a very efficient way, $(6)making all mob kills count as player kills.$()$(p)This makes them an excellent choice for a mob farm, as they also $(1)won't kill dropped items or XP.

pages.title: Chaosbark Trees
pages.text: These trees of pure darkness are located in $(thing)Corrupt Plains, Forest, and Cliffs,$() but are most common in the Forest. There is nothing special about the Chaosbark, but the Logs can be made into Planks, or processed in the Lumber Mill to get $(2)Chaotic Sawdust.

This rare ore is speckled at the bed of a $(thing)Corrupt Ocean,$() embedded in Corrupt Gravel. This ore is very hard, and requires a $(item)Mystium Shovel$() to extract from the gravel.$(p)Note that this is primarily $(6)what you need to progress.

pages.title: Corrupt Ocean
pages.text: $(7)$(o)A small sandbar from beneath a vast sea of Dark Energy.

pages.title: Corrupt Forest
pages.text: $(7)$(o)A hilly area with tightly packed Chaosbark Trees.

pages.title: Corrupt Cliffs
pages.text: $(7)$(o)A top of a high mountain peaking through the fog.

pages.title: Corrupt Plains
pages.text: $(7)$(o)A large and flat grassland, with dottings of Chaosweed and Prism Roses.

pages.title: Corrupt Desert
pages.text: $(7)$(o)A brain cactus amongst the sprawling dunes of sand.

If you've found $(item)Flerovium Ore,$() you have found what you came for. Feel free to keep exploring, or head back to the Overworld for some alloying.$(p)Having trouble finding Flerovium? Try crafting $(l:items/chaotic_reduction_goggles)Chaotic Reduction Goggles.$()
Grinding a $(thing)Prism Rose$() in a Grinder will result in a $(item)Prismatic Dust,$() a crafting component you will need to use for many alloys.
Combine $(thing)1 Prismatic Dust and 1 Mystium Blend$() in a Fluid Mixer with $(d)Condensed Void$() to get $(item)2 Nova Blend.

pages.title: R. Novasteel Compound
pages.text: Combine $(thing)1 Attuned Titanium Ingot and 1 Flerovium Ingot$() in an Alloy Smelter to get a $(item)Raw Novasteel Compound.
Finally, putting all of it together, combine $(thing)1 Nova Blend and 1 Raw Novasteel Compound$() in an Alloy Smelter to get a $(item)Novasteel Ingot.

With $(thing)Novasteel Ingots$() under your belt, you have reached the end of the Chaotic Age, and the structured tutorial. However, this is by no means the end of the mod, as there are still many things to do and machines to make.$(p)$(l)Thank you for playing Assembly Line Machines!
